# YAML 1.2
---
abstract: "The goal of mcfly is to ease the use of deep learning technology for time series classification. The advantage of deep learning is that it can handle raw data directly, without the need to compute signal features. Deep learning does not require expert domain knowledge about the data, and has been shown to be competitive with conventional machine learning techniques. As an example, you can apply mcfly on accelerometer data for activity classification."

You are welcome to contribute to the code via pull requests. Please have a look at the [NLeSC guide](https://nlesc.gitbooks.io/guide/content/software/software_overview.html) for guidelines about software development.

We use numpy-style docstrings for code documentation.
A deep learning tool for time series classification and regression

Navigate to `http://localhost:8888/` in your browser to open the visualization. For a more elaborate description of the visualization see [user manual](https://mcfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_manual.html).
Source code and data of mcfly are licensed under the Apache License, version 2.0.

The goal of mcfly is to ease the use of deep learning technology for time series classification and regression. The advantage of deep learning is that it can handle raw data directly, without the need to compute signal features. Deep learning does not require  expert domain knowledge about the data, and has been shown to be competitive with conventional machine learning techniques. As an example, you can apply mcfly on accelerometer data for activity classification, as shown in . 
If you use mcfly in your research, please cite the following software paper:

Prerequisites:
- Python 3.10, 3.11
- pip
- Tensorflow 2

Installing all dependencies in separate conda environment:
```sh
conda env create -f environment.yml

# activate this new environment
source activate mcfly
```

To install the package, run in the project directory:

`pip install mcfly`

We build a tool to visualize the configuration and performance of the models. The tool can be found on http://nlesc.github.io/mcfly/. To run the  model visualization on your own computer, cd to the `html` directory and start up a python web server: 
`python -m http.server 8888 &`

result.description: Regression and classification on your time series data using automatic deep learning architecture selection.
result.name: v4.0.0

result.description:
- Added support for training with Datasets, generators, and other data types supported by Keras [#211](https://github.com/NLeSC/mcfly/issues/211)
- Added separate classes for each model type, also allowing easier extension by own custom models [#239](https://github.com/NLeSC/mcfly/pull/239)
- Dropped support for Python 3.5 (supported are: Python 3.6, 3.7 and 3.8)
- Extend and update documentation in readthedocs [#250](https://github.com/NLeSC/mcfly/pull/250)
- Fix broken model visualization [#256](https://github.com/NLeSC/mcfly/pull/256)
result.name: v3.1.0

result.description: mcfly 3.0 lets you train new network types on your time-series data. It brings support for ResNets and InceptionTime architectures next to the already supported CNN and DeepConvLSTM architectures. Version 3.0 also brings API improvements, bugfixes and uses Tensorflow 2.0 under the hood.
result.name: v3.0.0

result.description: Add class weight support to work with unbalanced data sets.
result.name: v2.1.0

result.description: This release makes the switch from working on top of Keras (with Tensorflow or Theano underneath) to working on top of Tensorflow directly. Because of this dependency change saved models with earlier versions are no longer compatible with the current version.
result.name: v2.0.1

result.description: This release makes the switch from working on top of Keras (with Tensorflow or Theano underneath) to working on top of Tensorflow directly. Because of this dependency change saved models with earlier versions are no longer compatible with the current version.
result.name: v2.0.0

result.description: Small patch that changes the requirements of the package to require keras version lower than the absolute lates 2.3.0 as this version is net yet supported by mcfly.
result.name: v1.0.5

result.description: A release to fix citability and documentation format.
result.name: v1.0.4

result.description: This release is a small patch over v1.0.2. It fixes configuration with Zenodo so the release gets assigned a DOI. Also broadened the support for versions of dependency: six.
result.name: Improved packaging, now citable

result.description:
- Small bug fixes
- Added metric option to model training
- Extended documentation
- Removed redundant dependency on Pandas
result.name: Better documentation and stability

result.description:
- Small bug fixes
- Compatible with Keras v2.x (no longer compatible with Keras < v2.0.0)
- Tutorial is moved to separate repository (https://github.com/NLeSC/mcfly-tutorial)
result.name: Compatible with Keras 2.0

result.description: We will perform experiments with different datasets on this version of mcfly, so that we can make bug-fixes and improvements before release 1.0.0.
result.name: First version for experiments
